DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare effect multicomponent lipid emulsion contain 30 % soybean oil , 30 % medium-chain triglyceride , 25 % olive oil , 15 % fish oil conventional pure soybean oil lipid emulsion incidence neonatal cholestasis , infant growth , infant morbidity biochemical assessment liver enzyme .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Multicomponent Lipid Emulsion Preterm Infants Requiring Parenteral Nutrition
DOC.detailed_description: Intravenous lipid emulsion major source non-protein energy provision require essential fatty acid . The reference lipid emulsion , widely use many year , prepared soybean oil , rich omega 6 polyunsaturated fatty acid phytosterols contribute hepatotoxicity metabolite result pro-inflammatory eicosanoid production . Existing evidence strongly support pathogenetic role inflammation oxidative stress parenteral nutrition associate liver disease . Subsequent development lipid emulsion focus reduce amount soybean oil replace oils.Moreover omega 3 fatty acid fish oil metabolize anti-inflammatory eicosanoids prevent inflammatory response . A novel multicomponent lipid emulsion may prevent liver injury , improve growth decrease morbidity preterm infant .
DOC.criteria: Inborn infant gestational age le 30 week Who require parenteral nutrition least 7 day Evidence congenital infection Perinatal asphyxia Congenital anomaly Severe IVH Thrombocytopenia Shock circulation failure Renal hepatic disorder .
